comments.text: We got a ride to Lisbon by standing at the exit of the station.

Good place, ride to next gas station in about 20min

Talk to people!
Very good place, lot of cars. There is also restaurant and resting area so track drivers also can be asked.
First gas station after Vila Nova de Gaia on the way to Lisbon. Lots of cars going to nearby Aveiro. Took us 20 minutes to get a ride to the next service station.
Great spot if you wanna get to the beach without paying for bus ticket.
To beach very easy in summer, no long waits
Good spot if you're heading to the beach. Lots of trafic, good place to stop. I've hitched a few times there. Never waited more than 20 minutes.
Started very early with no cars, but a lot of cars coming out of Lisbon to the westernmost point of europe during the day and driving back in the evening
2 girls were waiting 5 min for a car. The men drop as the center of Lagos
Great spot to hitch south to Lagos, A22 and N125 or in the direction of Arrifana and Vale de Telha.
Perfect to go to Costa Nova. The third car stopped me. You need to be really close to roundabout because then there is a no-entry sign. Also not much space to stop a car.
Easy to get to the beach, especially in the morning around 10-11
With sign "Cabo da Roca".
Only one road and it was early in the morning. Hitchhiked straight in front of the campsite and got a friendly ride that took me to the highway
Very easy to get a ride to the airport. In general hitchhiking in the Azores is very easy, the only issue is some places might be quite empty, so choose your route having that in mind.
Easy lift to Monte with local workers
Outra Margem sign as mentioned before worked perfectly, guy took us two to the next gas station in the other side of the Tejo.
Very easy to catch a ride to Braga, there was many cars on saturday evening
We were super lucky that day. We thought of going by train but before we gave ourselves chance with hitchhiking. A car stopped in 2 minutes and took us directly to Porto
I guess luck - me + 1 arrived 11pm from Vigo on Sunday and when I was writing a sign I asked one driver who had took us to Lisbon later that night
got a ride to spain border. not the best spot but high traffic
got a ride to a service station off the highway after a few minutes. decent spot and people stopped, but cars going in many directions

Lots of cars at low speed, visible spot.

Young male with a dog with a sign to Portimão.
December Wednesday 13:00

Good spot to set a tent, if the weather allows. Tried for 20 mins at night and decided to rest.

The next day waited for 40min with a sign to Spain, got to Ayamonte. Lots of cars going in both directions, easier if you want to go closer.

February Saturday 9:00
Really good spot, bus stop. Lot of place, good to go in the south ! 🌸

We just arrived in a spot, start to write on the sing « Nazaré ». And one guy stoped his car, took us and go to Nazaré…. (Lucky maybe!)
You have to know : there is a ferry boat to crosse the river (free !), ask the locals ! 🌸

The spot is nice, lot of place for the car to stop. Buuut it was in Sunday, no a lot of car do this way ! 
You have to be lucky, after several cars 2 peoples took us to Aveiro. 🌸
There is a place for car to stop, we just started to write the signe one guy stop the car and toke us (lucky maybe). 🌸
Not perfect spot, because of high speed of cars. Generally okay spot with good visibility and place to stop
Huge place to stop (with a no-way street) and people are going really slow at the exit of the roundabout. We got a ride to the petrol station on the A10 towards Lisbon.
Two girl with a sign for Faro, got picked up in 5 minutes. There’s a gas station you can reach on foot where cars can stop. Lots of cars going in the right direction in late August!!
Two girl in late August, we got picked up immediately with a sign (Lagos/ south). We got many rides for short distances but we made it

It was my first time hitchhiking and I got a ride extremely fast. Maybe you want to stay more east because sometimes I thought someone stops but they were just using the indicator to go to the gas station.
Got a ride very quickly to Olhao.
good spot local traffic but it worked( Sign+thumb)

Got picked up instantly here (around noon). There's a very famous restaurant here, that apparently sells great sandwiches. "Bar 21"
Amazing spot for going east on the IP3!
spot on bus station so it’s totally safe place to catch the car, to stop and to get into the car

We were two with a sign saying “5km?” heading direction east (serra da estrela). Caught a ride to Luso after 20mins!
Great spot, since cars drive slowly by the roundabout and just behind theres space for them to stop:))
2 guys waiting in the sunday evening

Direction Coimbra. I was not going there (to Lisbon instead) however a young Spanish couple in a van stopped on that lane to offer me help, despite i was waiting on the lane to the highway. They were driving the very first vehicle who passed by and after i declined, no one else stopped. And no one really drove through my lane, so i walked back to Abrantes direction national road till a man picked me up for some km.

Departure spot mainly to north (Fundao, Covilha) and you can also be offered Lisbon as destination, despite indications to it being on the entrance by the other side of the bridge and a more suitable way starts in Castelo Branco Sul (southern highway entrance). After 30 minutes they offered me Lisbon, then i had to wait one more hour to Alcains where a dutch expat dropped me towards the countryside. In case you get stuck in the afternoon you can opt for provincial buses to north by "Quinta da da

Very good spot to continue the hitchhike to south. A water spring is available. Drivers smiled, 2 cars stopped within 40-50 minutes and the second one dropped me in Vila Real.
However, if you are going to Viseu/Coimbra, don't drop off on the western side of Vila Real where the bus station is, or you'll need a city bus to A24 entrance (5/31/51, cost 1,55€). Also if you wanna continue to Porto or the west, that highway entrance in Vila Real city centre looks steep and uncomfortable to wait at, so

Very good spot to leave Chaves towards south, you should come here by bus to Boticas and ask the driver to drop you at Autopista before Casas Novas (i departed from Boticas at 7:30am and he made an extra stop for me).
You should wait on the short lane where cars have just turned left and had time to see you. Most of drivers smiled. After 40 minutes a man in a modern pick-up took me to Vila Pouca de Aguiar and offered me 15€, this has been the first time within European continent :D
İn Vila Pou
Difficult spot to get to, but we were immediately picked up by someone going to Porto from Aveiro.

Used it two times with success, not a lot of space, but people often go to the border of Spain. My recommendation is to ask to drop you to the next highway rest area (Posto de Abastecimiento Cepsa A22 OLHÃO) if they just go to the border or not to your destination. People often rest here before going further into Spain
Parking by the river with camper vans and visitors. Very nice place to hitch a ride to Ponte da Lima/Viana or straight to Brag/ Porto
Good to go to lisbon!
Good for going to Lisboa. Big traffic. I waited with sign 15 - 20 minutes.
Me and my bf were trying to get to Spain. Local took us here and told us to write ‘Elvas’ on sign. We were lucky and get ride from truckmen to Madrid.
Most viable spot to hitchhike from Burgau, as traffic can be very little from the village itself. Enough space in both directions to stop cars and it also has a bus in case nobody stops for you.
Good płace to go to the highway
Asked 2 cars at the gas station, the 2nd one took us directly to Salamanca!
Very good spot! Lot's of people going to Salamanca. But you need to ask for a ride
good spot for direction porto
Good spot to get ride to Lisbon or Almada. Cars are going slow from the roundabout and there is place for cars to safely stop.
Bus stop. Easy to find for short and long distances
Got a ride to Porto very fast, good spot. Good amount of Cars.
Good spot if you wanna get back to Aveiro or somewhere nearby. Just stand next to the parking lot, so the drivers can easily pick you up.
easiest ride of my life

Couldn't even remove our backpacks, some French tourists already stopped. 5 star because it's easy for cars to stop, there is good space on the right. And both people coming from Seixal and Porto Moniz can stop for you.
3 local driver took us to Funchal
If you walk along the road cars will not too often (on Sunday) but there is a high chance of getting a lift.

Vraiment un super spot.
J'ai été pris 10 minutes après avoir fait ma pancarte en direction de Leiria

I don’t know why this spot is so great, looked on the map and it so much longer for cars to go through this spot than the other highway entrance. Waited quite a long time in the sun, nobody stopped and decided at the end of the day to take a bus
This is a great spot. Many times people first passed me and came back afer one round in the roundabout. Gives them more time to think :)
First class spot! Got an offer from Portuguese guy to Lisbon in less than 20 second. This is the spot to head south peeps!
we were 3 and got a lift in 45 minutes. i went just to Leiria, others went to Lisboa with the driver :)
Good spot but during december it took an hour and half to find someone, walked up to them and asked.
Relatively quick timing, guy was returning home because of Carnival (04/02/2025)
Perfect gas station. In summer lot of people go from Lisbon to faro on holiday and than back so you have big chance to get ride to Lisbon. I catch car to Lisboa in 5 minutes.
Last service station before A2 going to Lisbon. High chances of finding a direct ride to the capital.
Nice spot, lots of traffic and good visibility. I was looking to go back to France, but decided to get a ride with a couple going to Caldas da Rainha in order to reach a gas station.

Nice spot. Heavy traffic means a lot of people pass you, but we were picked up decently quick and taken to a gas station at Aveiras de Cima, probably wouldn't recommend accepting any shorter rides if going to Coimbra or further north.
Great spot! A guy there took us to the next station. It was close but from there we caught another ride. I really recommend
As we didn´t have luck at the gas station we tried it here and got a ride in 20min.

Traffic is heavy and road connects straight to the motorway. Take the metro to the airport, easy walk to here. First we tried the others spots further up the road for 3 hours with no luck and then got picked up after 20mins here!
Walked from albufeira to here with our sign to faro and stopped at the roundabout. Good place, waited there only for 10min to find a car going to faro airport
A spot closer to the highway and the national road; I got a ride to Lagoa here by the N125.
asked around at the entrance of store. people were nice but going different directions. after a few mins scored a ride to albufera (tavira)
Not a lot of cars, but still a sufficient amount. 20 minutes of asking around and a ride to Albufeira scored.
Two girls waiting for a car. It was Sunday and there weren't many cars. I think it's a good place.
Good spot, the car before dropped off here to go on the way to Spain. Lot of place for the car to stop, not fasty 🌸
waited here in the middle of the night (2am). after 30 min the first car came, stopped and took the three of us directly to lisbon .. but probably this was just good luck ;)
1 guy 1 girl we waited on a sunday afternoon and got picked up pretty quick, good spot as thé cars are slowed down and there is a lot of Space to stop
Just before the Jumbo gas station. This is the exit road towards the South and a lot of Southwards bound traffic comes by here. There's plenty of time and space for cars to stop to pick you up.

From the looks of it a very good spot for stopping, but we waited for quite some time on a monday afternoon with 2 people and a sign saying Porto. Might have been because of the time and other days could work better.

1 direct drive to Porto in 15mn !

Cars drive quite slowly, place to park, and a bit of straight between the 2 turns. The only problem they can't see you from far away. Pass away the interdiction for pedestrian people and after 10m be creative to pay attention of drivers.

For me, some huge hello! with my sign Porto and it worked very good. :)

I think it is a good spot for poeople going north (direction Villa Real/ Viseu), even though I was waiting for 1,5h here. To get here go north from the Old Town going by Avenida Fernao de Magalhaes, pass by the train station and bus station, then walk some 5 mins more in the same direction, just following the signs "Viseu". I was standing just after the sign "motorway", on the right side of the road.
had a sign with "outra margem" got a ride in 20 seconds over the bridge.
Great spot, put on my sign “ área de serviço Barreiro” and somebody picked me up to the next highway rest area

I took the advice above and held up a sign with "outra margem" and got a ride over the bridge quickly.
however, make sure the driver can actually drop you off at the next gas station (seixal) and isn't just going to a small city after the bridge, because it will be hard to find a ride there(happened to me)

It's a very good place to get a ride to the south side of the river, I like to write "outra margem" on a sign, you can also use "área de serviço Barreiro". You can easily be dropped at Barreiro service station on the highway just a few kms after the bridge, and from there find a ride to the next one "Palmela", and then you're on your way to Algarve, or Spain, or wherever south. Enjoy the view from the bridge and shout "Até já, Lisboa!"

I was with a friend, so maybe that's why it took longer for us, but we had to wait long. First we were standing here with a sign "España" for more than an hour and didn't get any rides. Than we changed the sign for "15 km south" so after a while someone took us till the first service station, where it worked better.

I arrived by plane in the evening around 10pm, it was already dark. There was already one girl hh towards albufeira. I was heading to Huelva. I was very lucky and after 10min got a ride straight to Huelva but without the girl hh there with me I'm not sure how long I would wait there. Probably I would have to sleep in the airport and in the morning get to the Faro city.

For us not the best spot. We were waiting there for 3 hours and after those hours under sun with paper "It's hot" stop us one girl who gave us ride closer to the center, but even there hard to get to A22 to Spain. For sure try the national one.

Excellent spot. At present, they are doing some works on the road just past the roundabout, so there is plenty of room for someone to stop. Waited here about 5 minutes and got a lift all the way to Madrid (by using a sign saying Espana). Use a sign as cars are going in all directions, but it is really busy.
Simply great. Enough space to stop cars and go to Faro down-town but you can try to go somewhere else (east or west). Less than 15 min.

Signs in general don’t seem to have worked for me so when I started asking people through Google translate I had much better results. Did this from 9:30am and at 11:20 a man was going to Fatima and said he can take me. March 8th during raining time and still all good. I’m sure you could find people straight to Porto or Coimbra but I wasn’t lucky enough
Good traffic going north. Easy for asking or thumbing.
First decent stop on the way from Lisbon in direction Porto.

A cargo van stopped for us and us going to Spain, but only had one stop and we were two. A lot of local traffic and not may people stop but for Iberian standards is good, also there is many places where cars can stop or talk with them
Good spot - many cars with place to stop, but I feel like it is really hard to catch hike with locals
Lot of local traffic, we manaed to get a ride to MarShopping only.
We waited 0 seconds for a ride, walked into the station and asked the first car we came too, probably luck, but the location makes a lot of sense and easy to get to

good place to go north to the coast.
just take a bus to the big shopping center "norteshopping", continue walking from there in direction to the airport and 500m after you've left the shopping-area behind you, you'll find a small stair on the left side which leads you directly to the gas-station.

waited there for 30 minutes. good spot!

The spot is good - but it took us quite long - almost 2h - as for 2 girls hitchhiking it’s quite long waiting time. We were standing with the Aveiro sign but it wasn’t working well, better just with the thumb up. 
The dors were open, but it took us a moment to find where to enter the path ;)

I recommend, but also I was very lucky. The doors were open and I've found a driver in less than 30 minutes. At the beginning I've tried to ask drivers at the station, but finally changed my tactcis. IMHO is better to stay with a cardboard by the road leading to the station (but leave it only a little, so as not to enter the highway!). Statistically you then have a better chance of finding a crossing
My asshole got absolutely obliterated by the fence but i survived. Got a ride after about an hour to exactly where i needed to go!
June 2019, Sunday afternoon, found a direct ride to Lisbon by a Portuguese couple in 25 minutes.

Arrived here 15.12.2017. Fences are quite okay they fixed the hole where with a hitchhiking sticker on. Agree with all the above there were only local traffic, and some language barrier sometimes.
Asked around people a while and eventually gave up and stood with the sign. 1 hour later got an offer from a German lady to Coimbra and from there got a direct ride to Lisbon easily. 

It's not the best nor the worst spot, average, and does worth a try. Once you got out this spot it should be better in

a great spot, however only aim for albufeira and try t be dropped on the highway rest area before there. i tried to go towards lisboa, no success, beja and évora didn't work, either. so i changed plans and headed to albufeira. can't think of a better spot in faro
Lot of local traffic, ended up standing just before the gas station on the rI oad. There is a lot of space for cars to stop, took me 10 minutes
Petrol station currently under construction (March/April 2022), so nobody driving out there at the moment, we checked for 5 hours :D
Good spot, we found a ride directly to Loule after around 15 minutes.
Only spot on the road where you can talk to drivers and ask them for a lift, we managed to find one ride after 40 minutes that took us to Portimao.
Was trying to get to Lisbon, but indeed most cars go to Faro. I still talked to two or three who were going to Lisbon, they just couldn’t take me. I ended up going to Faro.
Not a lot of traffic, but enough to keep you well occupied if you talk to the drivers. Most of the drivers going to Faro; we managed to get a ride to the next service station.

After I waited for an hour with a sign "Espanha", a guy approached me and took me after Salamanca. Apparently, many people at the station were willing to take me but thought Spain was too far. Be patient!
Waited with a sign to "Espanha", apparently many people were not going that far, but I've been lucky and found a ride for after Salamanca 🤞
Bad płace waiting for 4 hours. Maybe bad luck but not many cars here

many cars noone stopped for a ride to seville. was around and after sunset. creepy guy eventually drove me to first gas station in spain. crappy spot even less traffic . only portugese go for cheap gas and return. might be good during the day
We were going to this spot and someone take us just when we arrived on this spot with à sign
Not a lot of car in Sunday… but to escape the city it’s really nice, safe and car can stop ! 🌸
It is a really nice place for hitchhiking. A lof of nice people travelling along the coast. A lot of tourists :-)
Many serfers driving on this way. One took us with his amazing van.
Not the best spot I ever used, but also not the worst. After two hours and changing "Dirección Sevilla" cardboard for "Faro" some couple has taken me to Albufeira.
a great spot, once here you can get rides for as far as málaga or straight to algarve

Long waiting time (like everywhere on our route trough portugal) but definitly possible to get the ride from here to Lisbon. More people showed us that they go north - direction Porto. We tried different places on N234  from Mealhada but this spot after the rondo and before pay-gates was so far the best.
waited 40mins for a ride to ponta delgada. cars are going fast
Not a lot of traffic, but I had a sign "França" that didn't help because it's not the right direction. I got a ride immediately by asking around.
If you go south, better ask only for rides to Viana. From there it's easier to go to Porto. This spot got me a ride compared to the one on the south of the town
Direction Povoaçao. We hitched with 3 ppl late evening in the dark and worked just fine.
Good spot for car, they can stop, but it’s just local people and I think we can’t go fare way ! 🌸
Great spot to get out of Tondela to Viseu. I got dropped off in Vila Chã de Sá and walked to the rest area that is on the highway.
Nice spot but portuguese don't stop so much. We refused a ride to a city nearby, to have one going on the highway (we were going to Spain).
Got a ride from a friendly lady in the direction of Faro from here.
Not a bad spot. A lot of space for cars to stop. However I have waited for quite long even though the road is frequente
2 of us, Waited with a “5km?” sign by the gas station exit by the road leading to the highway, caught a ride to Mealhada!

Busy gas station on the way to the main highway (A1) heading norte.

Really easy at friday's afternoon.

Talk to the drivers and ask if they can take you to the next service area. Once in the highway really easy to go to Porto.

Disadvantages: near the city center, a lot of people just passing or going for the suburbs.

This is a good spot for patient hitchhikers who get rides city by city and not to their destination. I came here on the way from Chaves to Coimbra by bus 51, paid 1,55€. Buses 5 and 31 are also coming and do stop closer. Good traffic, most of them are workers going to other small towns, one offered me a 15km ride but had me refusing when he warned me very low traffic is leaving that village, so I should wait here for a longer ride.
After a hour I opted for a Rede Expresso bus to Coimbra for 10€
The pedestrian crossing slows down the cars and there is space on the edge to pull over in.
Got a ride in no time from a couple local youngsters north to VdConde. Niiiice.
Good to get into spain very low traffic though.
Great to get out of portimão. Lots of traffic on Sunday.
Good płace to go to porto
People are little afraid to stop bc of hard traffic but it's a good place and also there is a parking and restaurant nearby, waited 20min and got straight to lisbon

Waited about an hour.
Lots of pedestrians told us that people didnt trust hitchikers, but in wasnt that difficult at the end of the day
(Also, there is a LOT of tourists, especially french. If you are a foreigner, don't show off)
Hitched a ride from Arganil to here. No shade while waiting and quite dead around lunchtime on a monday, but eventually caught a ride to Coimbra from there. Lots of space to stop though.
There's not many good spots to hitchhike in Ericeira, but we managed to catch a ride to Lisbon.
A lot of tourists passing by so also some who are familiar with hh. I used the spot to get right to the highway.
male, alone, early 30s, asking round during the great blackout, fluent in portuguese

We (Girl & Boy) started asking around 14:45 and got a ride in 1 1/2h ! There were two other hitchhikers with us and they also got picked up relatively quickly. One with a sign and one asking the cars directly. I recommend doing both or atleast talking to them, that way they see how you are and you can google translate. Great spot 😁🌱

Good spot for catching! Lot's of cars going to A1 highway! We waited for 15-20min and a guy took us to the bus station and paid for our tickets to Porto!?!?! If you're going north it's a great place to stand!

Its easy to get here by public transport but we didn´t get a ride within 1,5h and then went to another spot a few kilometers down the road and got a ride within 20min. Most people from the gas station went back to Lisboa.

We tried to get a ride to the north but must people just went to some other part of Lissabon and there was not much traffic. In the end we went to another spot a few kilometers down the road and got a ride within 20min.
Waited for 30minutes with an algarve sign, Nobody stopped. After asking around for 5min if anyone was going to the south a guy took us down the highway for 20km, anything helps ;)
first guy I asked having a coffee was headed to alcacer do sal. dropped me at great service station there. March 2025

It seemed like most people were from the area and not going very far. I waited by the exit with a sign and didn't directly approach people so maybe that was why. However it's good as people in cars can see your sign in time and have space to park.
No need to jump the fence. Just ring the bell and the gate will open. Not a good spot for long distances but you can get further on the highway.

Well, I was unable to find an easy way to get in, so had to walk around to Western side, climb a fence, enter a highway and RUN 150 m as fast as I can.
Hitchability is rather poor, I was going in a direction of Spain, but most of the cars are occupied by local families and those who are not doesn't go far. Found a ride to one of the next gas stations in an hour and a half, assume it to be a better option for going Spain despite being a bit deserted.
P.S. reached this station to witness two Germa
Couldn't even get into the station. Unlike the previous comment, a person at the cafe essentially told us we can't enter and to go away. Waste of time unfortunately

A decent spot to hitch a ride towards Vila Real/Mirandela. A short walk from the train station; when we arrived there, a friendly man from the café nearby told us how to get to the station - just before the main gate there's a path to the left between the bushes. Take it and you'll get to a brick wall after around 5m. Climb it (easy with the help of the fence) and you're there! The 3rd driver we asked too us directly to MIrandela.

By the bus stop is very shitty if you are trying to go to Lisbon or onto the 22, because everyone is turning right to the airport. But standing into the middle where the white lines are i managed to get a lift - but i’d reccomned closer to Faro if you have a sign - so you can get the traffic before they are on the highway. Thankfully a lovely Romanian dude stopped and gave me a lift to a service station.
Stood just next to the bus stop with a sign saying Lisbon and got dropped off 15 mins further north at another gas station

With a sign to Faro I was picked up and ended up in Huelva where I wanted to go. 
Picked up by tourists.

Cars driving too fast, not even noticing
Friday February 13:00
Little bit dangerous for us. But that works, we wanted to go to Spain but the man put us in Tavira (on the way)🌸

Es un buen lugar para hacer autostop.
Los coches no van muy rápidos y hay bastante espacio para que te vean y se paren.
Espere unos 40 minutos al mediodía y luego me llevaron a la frontera.

Hey :) my goal was to leave Coimbra to Aveiro. After 1h30 waiting in Casa do Sal with a sign I didn't have luck and I decided to walk for 40 min to the next point. I waited in this gas station (Galp), asking people if they were going in Aveiro' direction. 
After 50 min I got a ride to Aveiro from a very nice man :)

We wait around 45min to get a ride to Aveiro, however our goal was Viseu/Guarda.. Is not the best spot, but you can talk with people and some truck drivers in the gas station, maybe you'll have luck...
